intro: Lisianthius pedunculatus, commonly known as the purpletop vervain, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of violet to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments.
